ArticleTitle.sentence: NO sensing by FNR: regulation of the Escherichia coli NO-detoxifying flavohaemoglobin, Hmp.

AbstractText.sentence: Nitric oxide (NO) is a signalling and defence molecule of major importance in biology.
The flavohaemoglobin Hmp of Escherichia coli is involved in protective responses to NO.
Because hmp gene transcription is repressed by the O(2)-responsive regulator FNR, we investigated whether FNR also senses NO.
